resources.description: Gzipped MySQL export of direct subsidies data for housing, energy, non-profits, transportation. Contains data powering the program directory and direct expenditure search. The former is extracted from PDFs and CFDA.gov; the latter portion is a nonprofit-oriented subset of data from USASpending.gov's FAADS dataset.
resources.name: faads.sql.gz

organization.description:
This is a group for datasets relevant for [Open Data Day](http://www.opendataday.org/). Anyone can add datasets to this group so please just hit edit and add the dataset (if the dataset is not yet on thedatahub please just  add it using the Add Dataset link at the top of the page -- you may need to log in first!).

International Open Data Hackathon Day is an annual event in which people around the world gather to write applications, liberate data, create visualisations and publish analyses using open public data to show support for and encourage the adoption of open data policies by the world's local, regional and national governments.

The [Open Knowledge Foundation] (www.okfn.org) and [CKAN] (http://ckan.org) will be running an open data hack day at the Barbican in London in support of the event. More details here: http://www.meetup.com/OpenKnowledgeFoundation/London-GB/536442/
organization.title: Open Data Day 2011
organization.name: open-data-day-2011

name: subsidy-scope
notes:
Subsidyscope provides data related to US Federal government subsidies and their role in the economy.  In particular, their Tax Expenditure Database provides comprehensive information on "tax expenditures" -- the lowering of the taxes certain parties pay the federal government by allowing special tax exemptions, deductions or credits.

### Data

Tax Expenditure database contains more than 10 years of material. There appears to be no way to get all the data at once so the resources section just contains links for latest years.

### Openness: NOT OPEN

From [data page](http://subsidyscope.org/data/) (emphasis added):

> Subsidyscope maintains a variety of datasets. Some of them power the visualizations you see on the site, while others are used for behind-the-scene calculations. All of them are available for use under the terms of the **Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial 3.0 United States License**.
>
> If you reference Subsidyscope in another publication please include a link to the main page (http://subsidyscope.org/) or include a citation such as this:
>
> Subsidyscope.org. The Pew Charitable Trusts. Washington, DC. Accessed Month, XX, 20XX. Retrieved from http://subsidyscope.org.
title: Subsidy Scope - US Federal Subsidies Data
